references.paper_title: Retrieval-augmented generation for knowledge-intensive NLP tasks
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), laying the foundation for combining retrieval with LLM generation.

references.paper_title: Dense passage retrieval for open-domain question answering
references.reason: This work introduces DPR, a dense passage retrieval method that enhances retrieval accuracy and efficiency for open-domain QA.

references.paper_title: Self-RAG: Learning to retrieve, generate, and critique through self-reflection
references.reason: This paper proposes Self-RAG, a method combining retrieval, generation, and self-reflection to enhance retrieval accuracy and mitigate hallucinations.

references.paper_title: Autoregressive search engines: Generating substrings as document identifiers
references.reason: This research explores generating substrings as document identifiers, a pioneering approach in generative retrieval that streamlines retrieval and eliminates the need for explicit document indices.

references.paper_title: CorpusLM: Towards a unified language model on corpus for knowledge-intensive tasks
references.reason: This paper presents CorpusLM, a unified framework that unifies retrieval and generation on the corpus for improved performance on knowledge-intensive tasks.
